repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.unittitle: Leonard Windle Collection of Textile Related Photographs
did.physdesc: 1 file folder and one oversize photograph
did.abstract: Photographs of Davis & Furber Machine Company executives, foremen, and machinery.

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183> kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes portraits of Davis & Furber Machine Company executives, a photograph of a Foremen's Club outing, and photographs from the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I), Greenville, South Carolina.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Leonard Windle Collection of Textile Related Photographs #6750 P. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related Collections: 6750 G: Leonard Windle Collection of Textile Related Graphics 6605: Davis & Furber Machine Company Records 6605/001: Davis & Furber Machine Company General Records 6605 GPN: Davis & Furber Machine Co. Glass Plate Negatives 6605 G: Davis & Furber Machine Company Graphics 6605 F: Davis & Furber Machine Company Machine Company Film 6605 OH: Davis & Furber Machine Company Oral History 6605 P: Davis & Furber Machine Company Photographs 6605 PUBS: Davis & Furber Machine Company Publications

did.unittitle: Early Executives and 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibit
Item 1: James Henry Davis, Davis & Furber Machine Company

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Halftone. Image depicts Davis (1846-1886), a partner in Davis & Furber Machine Co. beginning in 1868. Davis is seen from the chest up, wearing a dark jacket buttoned up over a white shirt and dark tie. He has a very full beard. Davis was the son of George Lucien Davis and the brother of George Gilbert Davis, all associated with Davis & Furber Machine Co. in North Andover, Mass. James Henry Davis succeeded his brother as superintendent of the card clothing dept. at Davis & Furber in 1880. This image is reproduced in "The Davis & Furber Machine Co. and the men who made it," published in 1908. 9.5 x 14 cm. Copy B.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 2: Benjamin Whitney Gleason

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Halftone. Image depicts Gleason (1806-1884), an early member of what eventually became Davis & Furber Machine Co. Gleason is seen from the chest up, wearing a dark suit and vest, dark tie, and white shirt with a stickpin in the center of it. Gleason was an employee and then partner in Gilbert, Gleason & Davis, Gleason & Davis, and Gleason, Davis & Co., all precursors of Davis & Furber Machine Co., located in North Andover, Mass. This image is reproduced in "The Davis & Furber Machine Co. and the men who made it," published in 1908. 9.5 x 14 cm. Copy B.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 3: Woolen yarn spinning frames, unknown mill

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print, [ca. 1900-30?]. Image depicts woolen yarn spinning frames in an unknown mill. Signed in the lower left corner: "Yours truly, W.C. McLoughlin" and "Cotton Waste & Woolen yarn Spinning Frames." Photo is badly overexposed. 25.25 x 20.25 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 4: George Henry Gilbert, early member of Davis & Furber Machine Co.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Halftone. Image depicts Gilbert (1806-1869), an early member of what eventually became Davis & Furber Machine Co. Gilbert is seen from the chest up, wearing a dark jacket with darker (velvet?) lapels, dark vest and tie, and a white shirt. Gilbert was a founder or member of Barnes, Gilbert & Co., Gilbert & Richardson, and Barnes, Gilbert & Richardson, all precursors of Davis & Furber Machine Co., located in North Andover, Mass. This image is reproduced in "The Davis & Furber Machine Co. and the men who made it," published in 1908. 9.75 x 14 cm. Copy B.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 5: Davis & Furber Type L-7 Tape Condenser

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print snapshot. Image depicts the Davis & Furber Machine Company Type L-7 Tape Condenser on display at the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I), Greenville, South Carolina. The man standing in front of it is probably a D&F representative. A tape condenser is the delivery section on a card in the woolen system. 12.75 x 10 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 6: Attendees talking outside Davis & Furber booth, ATME-I, Greenville, S.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print snapshot. Image depicts some attendees at the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I), Greenville, South Carolina, talking outside the Davis & Furber Machine Company booth. The man in the center with the glasses is probably a D&F representative; see item 5 in this folder. 12.75 x 10 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 7: Attendees at the ATME-I, Greenville, S.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print snapshot. Image depicts several groups of attendees at the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I), Greenville, South Carolina, talking in front of the show displays. Banner hanging above reads: American Textile Machinery Association Offices and Information Center." 12.75 x 10 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 8: Attendees in front of Davis & Furber compact sliver card machine, ATME-I, Greenville, S.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print snapshot. Image depicts several men talking in front of the Davis & Furber Machine Company's compact sliver card with type G-4-B and tandem feeders, on display at the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I), Greenville, South Carolina. One man holds what looks to be raw cotton (?). 12.75 x 10 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 9: Attendees in front of Davis & Furber compact sliver card machine, Greenville, S.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Attendees in front of Davis & Furber compact sliver card machine, Greenville, S.C. Gelatin silver print snapshot. Image depicts four men (two shaking hands) in front of the Davis & Furber Machine Company's compact sliver card with type G-4-B and tandem feeders, on display at the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I), Greenville, South Carolina. Part of the carder is visible on the left. The man wearing glasses is probably a D&F representative; see item 5 in this folder. 12.75 x 10 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 10: Three exhibitors in front of Davis & Furber compact sliver card machine, ATME-I, Greenville, S.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three exhibitors in front of Davis & Furber compact sliver card machine, ATME-I, Greenville, S.C. Gelatin silver print snapshot. Image depicts two women, dressed in identical uniforms including broad-brimmed hats, and one man (shaking hands with one of the women) in front of the Davis & Furber Machine Company's compact sliver card with type G-4-B and tandem feeders, on display at the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I), Greenville, South Carolina. Part of the carder is visible on the left. The women wear exhibitor badges but the company name is not legible. 12.75 x 10 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 11: Four attendees in front of Davis & Furber compact sliver card machine, ATME-I, Greenville, S.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print snapshot. Image depicts four men chatting in front of the Davis & Furber Machine Company's compact sliver card with type G-4-B feeder, on display at the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I), Greenville, South Carolina. Machine is obscured by the men. 12.75 x 10 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 12: Attendees at the ATME-I, Greenville, S.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print snapshot. Image depicts several groups of attendees at the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I), Greenville, South Carolina, talking in front of the show displays. Banner hanging above reads: American Textile Machinery Association Offices and Information Center." 12.75 x 10 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 13: Attendees surrounding Davis & Furber machinery at the ATME-I, Greenville, S.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print snapshot. Image depicts attendees at the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I), Greenville, South Carolina, surrounding Davis & Furber Machine Company machinery. In the foreground is the D&F Type L-X Mixing Picker; in the background on the right is the D&F Compact Sliver card with Type G-4-B Feeder. The Davis & Furber booth is on the left. 12.75 x 10 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 14: Attendees surrounding Davis & Furber carding machine at the ATME-I, Greenville, S.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Attendees surrounding Davis & Furber carding machine at the ATME-I, Greenville, S.C. Gelatin silver print snapshot. Image depicts attendees at the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I), Greenville, South Carolina, surrounding Davis & Furber Machine Company carding machine. Machine is obscured by the men. Banner above reads: "Cematex European Information." 12.75 x 10 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 15: Attendees at the ATME-I, Greenville, S.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print snapshot. Image depicts a group of attendees at the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I), Greenville, South Carolina, talking in front of the show displays. A carding machine (Davis & Furber's?) is on the left; other machinery visible in the background. Several men lean over the balcony on the second floor in the background. 12.75 x 10 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 16: Attendees at the ATME-I, Greenville, S.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print snapshot. Image depicts several groups of attendees at the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I), Greenville, South Carolina, talking in front of the show displays. A Davis & Furber Compact Sliver Card with Type G-4-B Feeder is in the center of the room. Other machinery is visible in the background. 12.75 x 10 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 17: Attendees at the ATME-I, Greenville, S.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print snapshot. Image depicts several groups of attendees at the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I), Greenville, South Carolina, talking in front of the show displays. A Davis & Furber (?) carder is somewhat visible on the left. 12.75 x 10 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 18: Attendees at the ATME-I, Greenville, S.C., in front of the Davis & Furber tape condenser

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Attendees at the ATME-I, Greenville, S.C., in front of the Davis & Furber tape condenser. Gelatin silver print snapshot. Image depicts several men grouped in front of the new Davis & Furber Type L-7 Tape Condenser at the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I), Greenville, South Carolina. 12.75 x 10 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 19: Attendees at the ATME-I, Greenville, S.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print snapshot. Image depicts several groups of attendees in front of the machinery on exhibit at the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I), Greenville, South Carolina. 12.75 x 10 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 20: Attendees at the ATME-I, Greenville, S.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print snapshot. Image depicts several groups of attendees in front of the machinery on exhibit at the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I), Greenville, South Carolina. The Davis & Furber Compact Sliver Card with Type G-4-B Feeder is partially visible on the left. A weighing feeder full of raw cotton (?) is partially visible on the right. See item 22 in this folder for a better view of this machine. 12.75 x 10 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 21: Attendees in front of Davis & Furber Machine Company display at the ATME-I, Greenville, S.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print snapshot. Image depicts three men admiring the Davis & Furber Machine Company display panels at the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I), Greenville, South Carolina. The display panels offer off the shelf delivery of parts and supplies from North Andover (Mass.) or Charlotte (N.C.). The 12.75 x 10 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 22: New Davis & Furber weighing feeder at the ATME-I, Greenville, S.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print snapshot. Image depicts a man standing in the raw cotton in the new weighing feeder by Davis & Furber Machine Company at the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I), Greenville, South Carolina. The 10.5 x 12.75 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Item 23: Attendees in front of the Davis & Furber display at the ATME-I, Greenville, S.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print snapshot. Image depicts attendees at the 1968 American Textile Machinery Exhibition - International (ATME-I) in Greenville, South Carolina, in front of the Davis & Furber Machine Company display. The 12.5 x 10.5 cm.
Format: black and white photograph.

did.unittitle: Davis & Furber Foremen's Club

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: oversize photo

did.unittitle: Item 1: Davis & Furber Machine Company Foremen's Club Outing, Amesbury, Mass.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gelatin silver print, [1959]. Image depicts a number of men playing horseshoes in the center right foreground. Other men lean against cars parked on the right and the left. Written on reverse: "D & F Foremen's' Club Outing Amesbury, Mass. Used in D&F News July 1959." 41.5 x 18.5 cm. (w/out mount); 43.25 x 23.25 cm. (w/mount).
Format: black and white photograph.
